required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ketamine for Reduction of Alcoholic Relapse
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo- Controlled, Multi-site, Parallel Group Clinical Trial to Examine Ketamine as a Pharmacological Treatment for Alcohol Dependence in an Alcohol Dependent Population

brief_summary.textblock: 96 recently detoxified alcoholics will be randomized to receive either 3 sessions ketamine (0.8 mg/kg IV over 45 minutes) or placebo plus manualised psychological therapy, or 3 sessions of ketamine or placebo plus simple psychoeducation. Patients will be assessed at 3 and 6 months on a range of psychological and biological variables. Primary endpoints will be % days abstinent at 6 months and relapse rates at 6 months. Secondary endpoints include depressive symptoms, craving, quality of life.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

group.title: Ketamine+Psychological Therapy
group.description: Ketamine with psychological therapy Ketamine: 0.8 mg/kg ketamine Psychological Therapy: Manualised relapse prevention based CBT

group.description: ketamine with alcohol education Ketamine: 0.8 mg/kg ketamine Alcohol Education: Simple education about alcohol effects

group.description: placebo with psychological therapy Placebo: 0.9% saline Psychological Therapy: Manualised relapse prevention based CBT

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Relapse Rates
outcome.population: To explain discrepancies between overall number of participants analysed and the flow diagram: Only participants with a minimum of 159 days of completed drinking self-report data were included in the main analysis of alcohol relapse status as this was the shortest duration of time before any participant completed the 6 month (23-25 week) follow up in the study. Reporting time was capped at 180 days.

measure.title: Relapse Rates
measure.population: To explain discrepancies between overall number of participants analysed and the flow diagram: Only participants with a minimum of 159 days of completed drinking self-report data were included in the main analysis of alcohol relapse status as this was the shortest duration of time before any participant completed the 6 month (23-25 week) follow up in the study. Reporting time was capped at 180 days.

analysis.groups_desc: Confirmed alcohol relapse by drug condition at 6 months using the Alcohol Timeline-Followback. Logistic regression modelling was used to compare the ketamine group with the placebo group (combined across therapy and alcohol education).

group.title: Ketamine+Psychological Therapy
group.description: Ketamine with psychological therapy Ketamine: 0.8 mg/kg ketamine Psychological Therapy: Manualised relapse prevention based CBT

analysis.groups_desc: Linear regression modelling was used to compare the ketamine group with the placebo group (combined across therapy and psychoeducation). Only participants with a minimum of 159 days of completed drinking self-report data were included in the main ITT analysis as this was the shortest duration of time before any participant completed the 6 month (23-25 week) follow up in the study. Reporting time was capped at 180 days.

reported_events.time_frame: Screening visit (visit 1) to 6 month follow-up visit (visit 10).Participants were asked about any potential adverse events at the beginning of each visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
